channel.title: cs6501: Evaluation Crisis in Computer Science
channel.description: Recent content on cs6501: Evaluation Crisis in Computer Science

item.title: Discussions Site
item.description: The course materials and most of the activities are in the github discussions site. Note that this is a private repository for participants in the seminar. Later in the semester some more materials may be posted here, but unlike other courses I have led where nearly everything is public, for this seminar it seemed there were enough advantages to keeping our discussions in a private group that most seminar materials will not be posted here.

item.title: Syllabus
item.description: UVA CS6501 Fall 2024 Evaluation Crisis?in Computer Science Course Goals Over the past two decades, psychology, medicine, and other social sciences have recognized a replication crisis in their work and taken measures to improve the quality of their science. Experimental computer science, which includes nearly all work in computing systems and machine learning, uses different forms of evaluation which do not usually incorporate the complexity of human subjects, but still suffers from a similar crisis.

item.title: Welcome to the Seminar!
item.description: Welcome to cs6501: Evaluation Crisis in Computer Science! This is the public course website for UVA’s cs6501 Fall 2024 seminar lead by David Evans. Our first class meeting will be on Wednesday, August 28 (11:00am in Rice 340). A preliminary syllabus is now available, and should give you a good idea what to expect in the seminar, although it is not yet finalized. More material will be posted here as the beginning of the semester approaches.
